Stayed at this place because I had a business meeting in downtown Seattle. This hotel is right in Downtown seattle but is in the Pioneer square area. To me, this area was pretty bad and I would walk around there alone (I am a woman). I would not feel safe there. Anyway, the hotel is pretty nice and the customer service is first rate. The room was very large but the bed was extremely uncomfortable. Great pillows but my body ached from sleeping in the very hard bed. The shower was the best part! Big and plenty of hot water!! I loved that part! Luckily I didn't have to pay for the room but it was pretty expensive - not worth the money to me. And, parking is a mess there - you have to park about 2 blocks away in this parking garage that is not run by the hotel. It is very inconveinant.....none

This hotel is great if you are looking for a nice, boutique-ish hotel in downtown Seattle, as long as you don't mind the "culture" of Pioneer Square. There are definitely better hotels, but this is just a few blocks from the two stadiums and in the middle of a district with great shopping. Pioneer Square does have a bit of a homeless problem, but I've never seen that spill into the hotel. The rooms as fairly small, but nicely appointed. Free breakfast is okay.none

We had a nice stay in Seattle for two days in this hotel, until the moment we were checking out. We had noticed what appeared to be vagrants sitting in the unattended lobby a couple of times, including the early morning were checking out. My wife left our bags for a moment to get a muffin at the continental breakfast and when she came back to the bags, her handbag was gone, and so was the fellow who was sitting across from her. I was at the counter checking out and didn't see anything, but I did see the suspicious fellow sitting in the lobby as I move our bags. The manager was not there, as it was a Sunday, and they have treated us like we're trying to pull a scam. They claim no liability for baggage untended, but they should at least take responsibility for making sure their lobby is clear of derelicts waiting to prey on their customers. From about 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. there is supposed to be someone at the front door, but outside those hours they have nobody there, and the clerks are unable to see who is coming in or leaving. The manager says they have security cameras, but I think she was bluffing to see if I backed off of our claims. None of the other employees there that morning knew of any cameras. Furthermore, the manager NEVER returned any of my calls as promised. We feel we've been treated disrespectfully, and none of our suggestions have been taken seriously (ie the need for full-time front-door concierge/security). That part of Seattle has really become full of vagrants. BEWARE!!none

Location, location, location. Leave the car at home, take the train to Seattle: PSH is within walking distance from King Street train station. Located in the heart of historic Pioneer Square, it's convenient to waterfront, antiques, art galleries, designer-furniture, fine restaurants and pubs, clubs and theaters, the International District, Pike Place Market, downtown ferries and Alaska Marine Hwy. I've stayed there in 2004, 2005, and recommend it to all my friends.none

I love this hotel! The staff was amazing, we had never been to Seattle before and were probably terribly annoying with our endless questions and need for directions, but the staff was extremely patient and every person we talked to was just great! I can't say enough good things about the Best Western Pioneer Square, we chose it for the location, but the room was spotless and we had such a great time, we will definitely be back!none

We were booked to stay here for two nights from the 31st of august , we arrived at about 7PM only to be told that thay had no parking. We were given directions to some public parking but they did not tell us that there was a match on in the stadium. we could not find anywhere to park so we drove to the best western executive inn by the space needle to see if they had any rooms..We were very impressed with the service. they phoned back to the pioneer square to see if we could transfer our booking, which they did at no extra charge.{well done Best Western}.so remember to book a parking space when booking your room if you are driving.none

We stayed here in late August. This hotel is a decent stay for a decent price for this time of year. The service is awesome. They would clean our room in the morning and again in the late afternoon with candy on the pillow. It is in such a historic area and right across the street from Pier, underground tour and waterfront walk. The area is in a positive transistion for such an older area of town. Lots to see and do and easy to catch the bus to other areas of town. Hotel is totally redone and refurbished with great service. If you don't care about having a room with a view, much cheaper rates. It is however in the older area of town and the panhandlers are everywhere. Panhandlers are quite polite, but aggresive.none

great location, large , clean room and very comfortable beds. we got a great deal as we were there right at the end of the "off season". renovations are going on but the biggest inconvenience was our inability to go into the lobby from the main door for an hour or two. . . no big deal.. staff was very nice and attentive. good value for the money. would definitely stay here again!!none

Just stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Seattle for three evenings. They are undergoing a renovation and the newly renovated room that I had was fresh, had good amenities e.g., each side of the bed had a plug for me to plug in my computer! Colors are really nice. Workout room is nice as well. What makes this hotel so great is their staff. Top notch and makes everybody who walks through the door feel welcomed. Just amazing. The location of this hotel is excellent as well - walkable to everything. The link from the airport stops 2 blocks away from the hotel and is an excellent alternative to cabs and super shuttle. I highly recommend this property. Every time I stay here I just fall "in like" again!none

Rooms are ok-decent sized, fit and finish is unspectacular, no views to speak of. Staff is ok but don't valet your car because it takes weeks to come back. Restaurant average. Hotel is not super expensive but it probably fair value at best.none
Fun and funky! Our poor Marco the goldfish died within hours of having him :-( Nice room, great staff! Great location. Enjoyed the happy hour. I will be back.none

Just stayed at the newly remodeled Hotel Monaco in Seattle. The new furnishings are hip, comfortable and high quality. And the staff continues to be helpful and courteous. I enjoyed a well-mixed nightcap and tasty breakfast at Sazerac, and used the clean, modern workout facility.none

Had a great stay at the Hotel Monaco. The rooms were gorgeous and huge, bed so comfortable, staff was super accommodating and the location was great. Although the price is a little high, it is well worth it as this was one of my best hotel experiences ever. They are also pet friendly which is nice and a lovely goldfish (courtesy of the hotel) was my roommate for the stay. I have since joined the Kimptons loyalty plan and will definitely stay at their hotels when available.none

I spent many nights here on business trips over the past several years -- so many in fact that I (sadly) joked with the valets and the front desk staff that I saw them more frequently than I saw some of my friends back home. It is a good hotel, very well located and the service is excellent. The property has been refreshed over the past few years (and I believe is still being done).none

Excellent service, highly recommended. Great location in downtown Seattle. Easy walking distance to quality dining, not far from the Space Needle. It was a business trip but still had a great time and enjoyed my stay at the Monaco.none

My husband, dog(Shelby), and I have stayed at this Hotel Monaco twice and the one in Portland once. We joined their Kimpton Hotel loyalty plan and have been treated like treasured guests ever since. Their stated goal is to be the "most loved" hotel company and they have certainly endeared themselves to us. On this trip their dedication to top-notch customer service was evident even before we arrived. We were staying downtown to celebrate my husband's birthday. I had reserved an upgraded room online, but then worried later that it might not be one of their dog-friendly rooms. I called to make certain it was all okay and spoke to a really nice woman (wish I'd gotten her name) who assured me that there are dog-friendly rooms of each kind and that our reservation was all in order. She noted that we are members of the Kimpton In-Touch program and that we were going to be there for a special occasion. She asked if we would like to have a bottle of wine or champagne in the room. I stammered a bit and said that actually we are micro-brewed beer hounds. She said she would see what she could do. So, we arrived downtown around 1pm and thought we'd see if they would let us leave our car there while we went to eat lunch and wait for our room to be ready. We were delighted to find out that our room was already available and we could unload the car. The valet was very sweet to our dog and helped us juggle the luggage, dog, jackets, keys, etc. Inside they have an adorable chalkboard with the names of all the dog guests posted. They also give you a little gift bag with dog treats, a dog toy, and clean-up bags. The lobby has a lot of seating areas, a fireplace, chess set, and complimentary wine around 5ish. I'm not sure what the decorating scheme would be called, but it's warm and comfortable as opposed to a lot of the trendy places with hard surfaces and mod colors. Our room was decorated in a similar fashion to the lobby and included a sofa, lounge chair and desk with desk chair. There was also a bed on the floor for our dog. The bed for the humans was huge and had crisp linens and lots of pillows. The bathroom was a nice size and instead of those little bottles of shampoo and such they had large dispenser bottles in the shower. Probably better for the environment. After dropping our things we went out to explore the city. The hotel is in a great central location and you can leave your car there and walk all over the place. When we came back a couple of hours later there were three bottles of Pike Place Brewery ales chilling in a bucket of ice. There was also a personalized card written to my husband wishing him a happy 56th birthday. It was signed by the Chief Concierge, Jesse Peterson. Too cool! The next day we had a really delicious brunch at the adjoining restaurant, Sazerac. After we returned home I filled out an online questionnaire and gave them high marks for making us feel so special while we were at the hotel. I then received a 'thank you' email from the Director of Operations and it wasn't a form letter! These people are SERIOUS about customer service. I have recently slacked-off on writing reviews because it's time consuming and I feel a little bit like "why would anyone care what I think", but when a company puts so much time and effort into making sure I'm happy I'm glad to talk about them to anyone who will listen.none

We made last minute reservations (day before) for an overnight in Seattle. The benefits of being a Kimpton In-touch member certainly paid off, we had a decent rate, free parking and a $20 dinning credit. The room was beautiful we love how each room is a bit different and it's not like the "standard" whenever you stay at a Kimpton, unless the standard is "cool"! We had very friendly and helpful service from when we dropped the car off at valet all the way to check out the following morning. When we dropped off the car we mentioned that we'd need a taxi in about 30 mins, as soon as we came back out the valet mentioned that he hadn't been able to get a taxi yet, but that there was a town car available that would take us where we needed to go for the same price as a taxi. Bonus! A very nice gentleman then took us to Queen Anne and it was much more pleasant than a taxi. We just appreciated that on a busy Saturday night the valet actually remembered that we had requested a taxi.none

This was my first stay at a Kimpton hotel, and I have to say I was pleased. We had a very late check in, so I was happy to have a speedy experience at the front desk. We ordered a quick bite with room service, which was a nice to have available so late at night, and it arrived quickly. We had a Monaco King room which was pretty spacious, with a desk area, lots of room, and a really comfortable bed. The only thing I wasnâ€™t really crazy about was our shower had built in dispensers of shampoo and conditioner instead of individual bottles. They do, however, offer a handful of amenities at the front desk such as toothpaste and the like if you forget to pack them (some free, others for a fee). We had an issue with our mini fridge, and not only did they service it right away but they immediately brought a cold drink from the bar downstairs since what we wanted from the fridge wasnâ€™t cold. At every encounter the staff was friendly and efficient. Ask for a goldfish, and your stay is complete! It is centrally located so you can walk to many attractions in the city. Itâ€™s extremely close to Pike Place Market, and you can walk down to the original Nordstrom. They have complimentary coffee in the morning, and I think a cocktail hour in the evenings? We booked the $1 breakfast, which was okay â€“ for $1 itâ€™s a perfectly fine continental breakfast, but donâ€™t expect to be full. Thereâ€™s actually a great little bakery across the street down a block by the Fairmont that I would recommend for excellent pastries like ham and cheese croissant, cinnamon buns, etc. I would stay here again, and will probably seek out their properties in other cities. I also recommend joining their loyalty club for some nice extra perks like free WiFi.none

We are in a recently renovated 8th floor Mediterranean King Room. It is Big and Beautiful. Very chic! The two person jetted tub is DEEP :0 Lots of cool details throughout the room. No view At ALL tho. We walked in with no reservations and asked to book a Mediterranean King Room. The front desk clerk said they were booked. I told him I had just seen four room categories available on line within the hour. He then said he had found one room available, but couldn't offer AAA or Gov't rate. The rate from the front desk was $45 higher than what I'd just seen on line (with AAA ($186) and also included a $20 dining credit in their outstanding restaurant, Sazerac), so I stepped into the lobby made the reservation and waited for it to show up on their system (that made time for a quick drink anyway.... :) The front desk staff were very pleasant throughout the process and offered to store our bags while we got things arranged. Check out our photos of Room 801. We love Kimpton Hotels and will be enjoying their complimentary wine hour in the gorgeous lobby shortly.none

My husband and I stayed at our 3rd Kimpton in Seattle Hotel Monaco and once again...we were not disappointed! Love the Kimpton family hotels, pet friendly, hosted evening wine hour and the most friendly staff! We visited the bar in Saerac during the afternoon and had the most delightful waitress and ate breakfast there the next morning and it was just delicious! Great location on 4th Ave...blocks from Pikes Place Market, Nordstromâ€™s, Space Needle and so much more!none

My husband stayed here on business quite some time ago, and everything was excellent. This time, we were not as impressed. The service was still excellent. And they have complimentary wine in the lobby for an hour each evening. That was nice! And the location is great -- walking distance to Pike's Market and lots of shopping. One of the first things I noticed when we got to our room was that the upholstered chair next to the bed was in tatters. No kidding. In at least four places it was not just threadbare, but literally torn down to the stuffing. For a hotel of this quality, this is completely unacceptable. Perhaps one of their doggie-guests been chewing on the chair. That's another thing. We didn't realize it was a pet-friendly hotel. I don't know if that's a new thing, but my husband never saw any pets there the first time around. Maybe because it was during the week, and this time we were there on a weekend. I'm fond enough of dogs, but I don't really want them staying in the hotel rooms that I stay in. However, it's my fault for not noticing the pet-friendly tags on their website beforehand. The dogs were well-behaved overall. There were several in the lobby off and on, and we heard barking twice from our room. Lastly, the weekend rate in February was a great deal, we thought. But that was before we added in the cost to valet park. It's posted $36 a night, but with taxes it was about $44/night. So be sure to figure that when you're looking at room rates.none

I called before I arrived and the staff was so friendly and helped me arrange dinner reservations for when I arrived. Hotel Monaco is only a couple blocks from the light rail, so from the Seattle Airport it is only $2.75pp. Get off at University. Just a 30 minute ride. Easy. When checking in again the staff was so nice and the room was good size and clean. The only negative is request another blanket for the bed. There is no bed covering. We just like the feel of a heavier blanket. Food at Sazar was good and reasonable. Busy at the bar at night. We really enjoyed our stay at the Monaco. You can walk to everything. Just if you go down to the pier it is a heavy climb back to the hotel, so just get a taxi, it is only $4. OH and the Seattle libary is right across the street. I would recommend this hotel if visiting Seattle.none

My family and I recently stayed at Hotel Monaco for a trip after Christmas and the location of the hotel can't be beat. We walked to the Public Market, shopping each day and to dinners. The staff was extremely helpful on giving directions and suggestions on places to eat near by. Not only were they helpful, but so friendly and remembered us each time we arrived back to the hotel. The restaurant in the lobby had great food too...highly recommend it.none

I booked a room here that they upgraded to a lovely suite (with separate elevator I might add) for just a few extra bucks. I stayed here on my first visit to Seattle and I was not disappointed. I ordered room service for dinner my first night and had one of the best burgers ever, and the gentleman that delivered it could not have been nicer. The staff greeted me everytime I left or came back to the hotel. A big plus for me was the free copies of the NYTs in the morning and also coffee and wine (free ) in the lovely lobby area. I would definitely return here without a doubt!none

The Hotel Monaco in Downtown Seattle is an exceptional hotel; not just for its great location in the heart of the city, not just for the excellent and clean facility, price and room quality but primarily for its staff. From doorman to manager the Monaco excels in delivering an exceptional customer experience in making you feel welcome everytime you step through the front door. When visiting it is a must to experience the wine reception or a beverage in the bar and to take the time to get to know the staff.none
Great place - except you have to pay for wi-fi - seriously ? At your prices, in this day and age???? Everyhting else was perfect. Joan Knone

I was very happy with our stay at Hotel Monaco. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and the restaurant was awesome. The restaurant has an open kitchen and we enjoyed sitting at the bar talking with the chef. The food was the best we had the entire trip. There were only two downsides: the view from our room, right into another building...and the parking. We own a large pickup truck which was too tall for most standard (6'8) parking garages. Neither the front desk or the doorman could direct us to a lot that would accomodate our truck. It took us an hour to find parking 8 blocks away. However, after that hour, we had a wonderful time and enjoyed the hotel and the city. I can't wait to return!none

Rooms were great, got a coffee pot in the room if requested. I had a mediterranean king and it was very spacious. Not much of a view, which was disappointing but the room was good. Had a fridge in it which was helpful. Also a jacuzzi tub. The complimentary wine hour was very nice.none

This hotel has it all. Great location and amenities. In Seattle over Thanksgiving and enjoyed warm hospitality in their spacious lobby, complimentary mulled drinks and comfortable ambiance. Rooms were very clean, modern, and quiet. Easy access to light rail transportation 1 block from hotel and walking distance to shopping and Pike St. Market., We would definitely stay again.none

We stayed at the Monaco late last December. When I called to make the reservation I casually mentioned to the central booking agent that it was our anniversary. Honestly, I didn't do this to curry favor. When we arrived the receptionist mentioned our anniversary and gave us a room upgrade. It was unexpected and delightful as well. It was a room with a sitting area, plush and spacious. That evening a bottle of champagne and chocolates showed up in our room! Beyond that, every employee that we met, without exception, seemed genuinely interested in making our stay better. They also had a wine tasting social that was extremely well done with healthy pours. Stem to stern our stay was wonderful.none

We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Monaco Seattle. The location was perfect. The staff was very kind and helpful. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The decor of our room gave it a very homey feel. Loved siting in the lobby in the morning by the window and watch the city wake up. The restaurant was very good with excellent wait staff, especially John. Very easy to walk to wherever we wanted to go. Pike Place, movie theaters and downtown shopping just a few blocks away. Several excellent restaurants also within easy walking distance.none

I stayed at Hotel Monaco while on business. The property was located not to far from my office and close to the downtown shopping area , famous pike place market and restaurants. The staff was very kind and helpful. Room service was fast, the food was hot and good. Also, the restaurant in the hotel is amazing! The rooms are spacious, I had a monte carlo suite (way to big for 1 person) that had a king size bed, flat screen TV, as well as a sitting are with a couch, chair, desk and yet another flat screen! The plush jungle theme robe are an added plus! There was even turn down service in the evening complete with chocolate! Great place if you are visiting the Seattle area.none

Good, not great. Hotel has a circus-like feel. Can walk to lots of restaurants, attractions, and coffee shops! The staff is helpful and friendly. The gym is really small - only has one treadmill. The afternoon wine hour is a nice touch.none

I must say, the Hotel Monaco struck me as a bit odd. I've never been to a hotel where colorful nature murals adorn vaulted ceilings in the lobby. The whole place feels a bit plastic and out of place. That said, the staff was very helpful and the hotel had some nice amenities that give it a nice touch. If you're looking for a luxury hotel where everything is adorned in gold, this isn't your place. In fact, I'd call it entry-level luxury. Not so much luxury, but comfort, spaciousness, perfect cleanliness, and attentive service. The evening wine tastings are a nice touch. The location is an easy walk to the water, Pike Place, or shopping. The bed was comfortable and the place had all the equipment you'd expect in a hotel like this. Some of the touches, like the alarm clock, felt very chain-like, reminding me of what every Hilton in the world equips it's rooms with. But the Monaco has subtle touches that make it stand out and give you a warm feeling, with a room decor that almost evokes a British tea room. Overall, a nice hotel, nothing outrageous, but the value proposition was very good as my girlfriend and I celebrated our birthdays in Seattle.none

We were greeted by the most friendly receptionist I have ever encountered. She was very helpful and efficient. Our kids loved the pet goldfish in our room. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The restaurant was great too and we looked forward to our breakfast every morning. The location is handy to the attractions of Seattle. We took the bus to Museum of Flight without a problem. Pike markets are an easy walk from hotel. The only downside is the walls are a bit thin and we could here a barking dog on occasion - coming from Australia we are not used to dogs in hotels. I would stay here again. Almost forgot my husband and I enjoyed the complimentary wine at the end of the day.none

Over the New Year's holiday, we enjoyed our first two-night stay at the Hotel Monaco. We frequently travel in North America and Europe and often to Seattle but had never stayed there. They pay attention to the guest in so many ways: examples: the personal email reservation confirmation, genuine care, pleasant conversation and excellent service from all: front desk staff, room service staff, cleaning staff, managers, and especially the valets - we forget the importance of that first encounter with a hotel - the parking valets!- and follow-up personal response to us following our completion of their service survey. This, in addition to a very competitive nightly rate, a very, very clean and comfortable room, great food, the 5-6 complimentary wine service for guests, and, oh, those comfy robes! Monaco is now 'our' hotel in Seattle.none

This is an wonderful hotel and an excellent value. There are many charming aspects to the hotel, as other reviewer note. But the best thing was the service. Everyone here was extraorinarily helpful; they really went the extra mile to make our trip enjoyable!none

Everything was grand!!! My first time to take my Bandit to the city, she and I LOVED it!! Everyone was so nice, she got a bed and treats in our room. She is a very special 3 year old Papillon. Her and I got to wear our fur coats as it snowed during our stay. She got to meet alot of great other dogs and people :) Thank you! We will be back! Kym St.Clairnone

Valet parking fee is $40 for the stay with no other options for parking available close by. Maybe reasonable for downtown Seattle but kinda pricey for a one night stay. Got a kick ut do the complimentary pet goldfish. That was a first!none

perfect location in downtown seattle walking dostance to dining , shopping , pretty much any thing in DT . Rooms are very dated , reletively small bathrooms and paper thin walls. could hear when the room next door using their bathroom ! free Coffe in the lobby early in the morning ( 6 to 8 ) was a nice touch. If you become a kimpton memebr (its free ) you can use wifi for free . for the price paid , I've stayed in better hotels in Seattle . a printed list in the washroon tells you what items you can get for free in the hotel ,that lst include shower cap , toothbrush,.... you'll find a toothbrush in your room too , but if you use it you must pay for it , the list in the washroom refers to the toothbrush you should have asked for from the house keeping not the one already put in your room ! that one you should pay for !none

My ho-hum experience here started with the chilly reception we received from the night clerk. You know the kind--they look you up and down, decide you are not worthy, and act like checking you in is a big favor. Normally, I could care less, but we'd just arrived from a long train journey, it was dark and rainy out, we had our discombobulated 7-year-old in tow, and could have used some 'hail fellow well met' at that moment. Publicity boasts about catering to the young uns, but I had to search the website the next day to see what was available for him, and then ask, which put the morning staff in a flutter, because the person who checked us in--I'm looking at you, chilly night check-in guy--should have taken care of it. A much heralded gold fish was brought to our room, which then died. Okay, it happens, it is a living thing, but when we called to have it removed--more 7-year-old discombobulation--we were cheerfully told to put it outside the door, and chirpily asked if we'd like another. I know it's just a fish, but the attitude seemed rather cavalier, especially with a child involved. Yes, they have coffee and tea, but 2 days in a row I had to tell them they'd run out of hot water, breakfast tea, and milk. Don't count on it if you are off to business meetings in the morning as I was. And then there is the nickle and diming that I just can't stand when I'm paying hundreds of dollars for a hotel room--one-ply toilet tissue, big bottles of shampoo and soap bolted to the wall, slippers with a "if-you-use-these-we'll-charge-you-$15" tag attached to them. I moved to the Fairmont, got my slippers for free, had beautiful toiletries and was treated to super-friendly service at every juncture. Quirky can carry you only so far--it shouldn't come at the expense, literally and figuratively, of a comfortable stay.none
My wife & I stayed at the Hotel Monaco for New Year's Eve. As with all other Kimptons, the staff was super helpful and the property spotless. Nobody does it better!none

The Monaco is slightly quirky as is the case with many of the hotels in the Kimpton group - but it's good quirky! If you're looking for a hotel that has bags of character and doesn't feel like a generic beige property trying to be a boutique hotel, then this is the hotel for you. There are many nice touches: you can request a goldfish for your room if you like, you can get free coffee & tea in the lobby in the mornings and free wine in the lobby between 5pm-6pm. It's the decor that strikes you most.... lots of patterns that clash such as bold stripey wallpaper with patterned carpets, leopard print & zebra print bathrobes. The restaurant serves a pretty good breakfast and locationwise, it's great too. It's on 4th Avenue right opposite the W hotel, there's a convenience store round the corner on University St and it's only about a 4 or 5 block walk downtown to the stores. There are plenty of restaurants nearby too and it's a short walk down to the waterfront.none

On a recent business trip to Seattle I encountered one of the worst "hotel" experiences. Not only did I get food poisoning from eating breakfast at the Sazerac restaurant (restaurant at Hotel Monaco) but I had to extend my stay an extra day (cause I was so sick) and the hotel didn't even comp the extra night ($140) or the cost to change my airfare. In addition, I had to take "personal time" from workâ€¦.WHAT A WASTED 8 HOURS. THANKS!!! I had colleagues stay at the "W" (across the street from the Monaco). The "W" is much MUCH nicer and they didn't get food poisoning.none

This hotel absolutely blew me away! Everyone is exremely friendly and helpful. The rooms had very nice decor and the beds were so comfy! Also, the Monaco is perfectlly located, a 3 minute walk to Pikes Place and around 4 minute walk to the convention centre. Can't wait to go back!none

What a wonderful hotel to stay when in Seattle. The room was well appointed and the bed very comfortable. It's location is perfect for walking to Pike's Place, restaurants and the waterfront. Can't say enough about the staff. We, definitely, will stay there again when in Seattle.none

A truly beautiful hotel with the appointments that make it uniquely Kimpton. The Monaco Seattle was fantastic in every sense. The location provided for superior ease - whether to go down to the water, Pike's Place Market or walking distance to great restaurants and bars - perfect after business meetings for dining and exercise. Nearby shopping looked exellent but this was a business trip so I made note for future trips. While so close to many things, the doorman was fantastic and quick to offer assistance in providing car service to the airport upon our departure. The room was spacious and left no detail needed. Warm, soft sheets & covers and a superbly comfortable bed in a very clean room. The suite has plenty of room for two and was quite large for one. A nice set-up for working allowed me to conduct business and spread out. Plush towels and robes with a nicely done bathroom topped it off. The complimentary morning coffee and hot chocolate bar in the lobby was fantastic in the morning as was the wine in the evening. While we missed dining in the restaurant it looked divine and my travel colleague had been several times and sang its praises. The decor was gorgeous - and it completely lent itself to the holiday decorating that was classy and not ostentatious. Service was good and the business center had brand new Mac desktops; I had visited to print our boarding passes. I also poked around on the lower floor and would recommend this hotel for business / corporate meetings as well. A nice surprise after arriving home - the manager followed up with personal email. Kimpton does it right and the Monaco Seattle underlined it yet again. While they have two other hotels in the area that I have heard are great, I will defiitely return to the Monaco as it felt comfortable and elegant - and I felt appreciated as a guest.none
This hotel was VERY NICE! We enjoyed the shopping, the area and the atmosphere. Very well priced and the rooms were large and very clean. Can't wait to stay there again! Thank you, Cheryl S.none

Supposedly built in a former bank- welcoming cheerful staff- room 607 is large with Queen bed, no view- good small bath with lighted shave mirror and hairdryer; good bath amenities- T V and purchase films, the latter expensive- Avoid breakfast as it's too pricey; cross the street to the Seattle Brew or turn left to Starbucks- the hotel serves coffee in the Libby until 9 AM and has a 5 PM wine tasting with snacks which is free- only blocks from Pikes Place-none

We were attending Teatro ZinZanni in Seattle, to celebrate our 45th wedding anniversary, and looking for a nice hotel downtown to make the most of our visit. The Monaco offered a really great price to theater guests, so we gave it a try. Starting right at curbside, with the charming and helpful valets, we knew we made the right choice. The lobby was magical, with its holiday decor, and the desk clerks were professional yet casual at the same time (really?) We felt special when we used the room key-card to reach our "secure" floor in the elevator, and imagine our surprise to find his and hers jungle print bathrobes (which we immediately donned, snapped photos, and texted them to our grandchildren) and a goldfish we named BART to keep us company. The bed was comfortable, room clean and nicely decorated, everything we had hoped for, but it was "the little things" that made it a perfect fit for us.none

My husband and I have "getaways" in our own city. We stayed at the Monaco to celebrate our anniversary and spend some holiday time downtown.The staff was amazing. It was the perfect level of service. They were attentive without being overbearing, in a word, the service was excellent. Our room was very nice and they even left us a bottle of champaigne and some chocolates to help us celebrate! Very unexpected and a nice touch. We will definitely stay again at this hotel. We also had breakfast at the restaraunt and it was also very good.none

This was our second time staying at this hotel. The lobby is charming as are the rooms. We were able to get an upgrade when we checked in for $20 to a beautiful king suite. The staff couldn't be nicer. We had dinner at Sazerac and the food was very good. We usually don't eat at hotel restaurants, but we arrived late and decided to give it a try. We were definitely pleasantly surprised. Great service and food and plenty of choices. The complimentary hot chocolate with marshmallows and chocolate chips was a nice touch during the holiday season. We would definitely stay here again.none
The Hotel Monaco simply gets it right. I have stayed there a number of times and it is always a pleasure. Just book it!none

We loved the unusual decor! We had a "whimsical" striped room which was very quiet on the 9th floor. Easy efficient check-in with a very pleasant staff. We enjoyed the wine reception in the lobby before dinner. Very comfortable bed and Starbucks coffee in the morning. The room was a nice size although the bathroom was on the small side. Seemed like an older hotel, but well-maintained with an "Alice in Wonderland" quality.none

This stay was mine and my wife's first time at a Kimpton Hotel. We were very impressed, from check in, to the unique layout and design of our room, to the drinks at the restaurant connected to the lobby, this was a very good hotel. My conference was a few blocks away and the conference, along with short walks to Westlake Center, Pike Place Market, etc. were extremely convenient. The fish in our room was a "cool" extra too - we named him/her "Comstock." The best recommendation I can give is that I would certainly come back.none

Great service began as we pulled up for valet parking, and were immediately greeted. Front desk gave our large party rooms on the same floor, and assured us they had a wheelchair we could use for an elderly family member. After resting for an hour we came down for a festive wine tasting in the lobby area where a fire was burning and a large Christmas tree stood. In the morning fresh coffee, tea and hot cocoa was available early, then two mornings we had excellent breakfasts at Sazerac, the hotel's restaurant. No complaints at all.none

Oh, ho hum, this is getting really boring. Perfect stay, perfect staff, perfect 5-6 p.m. hosted wine hour, perfect place for our lovely pooch, perfect pillows, etc., etc. The location of the Monaco is just great and, although our puppy wanted some hot toddies at 5:00 p.m., I was the only one permitted to enjoy them. And of course, they are (my favorite word) free, during the hotel's nightly cocktail hour. The next morning, in addition to fresh-brewed Starbucks coffee (yes, there's that word again, free), there was a seasonally-inspired supply of hot-chocolate, which I mixed with marshmallows and a heap of other goodies. Yes, folks, just another perfect two-day stay in a fabulously-run hotel management company, Kimpton Hotels. Would I ever stay somewhere else? Well, maybe if it was FREE!!none

This hotel was very nice - the lobby, the rooms, and the location. The location was fabulous - my husband and I were able to walk everywhere we went - to the shops, market, restaurants, bars, docks. (There are a lot of hils though - down towards the shopping district was a bit flatter!) We never ate there, so I can't comment on that; but there were plenty of great places around, and the lady at the front desk gave us a breakfast recommendation that was one of the best breakfast I've had ... Lola, right on 4th St.! It was a great weekend, everyone was super nice, and the accomadations were excellent. I would love to go back!none

We had a great stay at Hotel Monaco. It was with trepidation that I traveled half way around the world with my nine year old daughter, however when we arrived, having emailed the hotel requesting early check-in, our room was thankfully ready. The check-in was fast and organised. Movie, voucher for my daughter and a mini-bar voucher for me. It is worth joining the Kimpton in-touch program. Best bits:The hotel is perfectly located, we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. The beds are comfy, it has nice decor, the cleanliness was fantastic and the pet fish was a nice touch. Finally you can't beat the service, from the door staff, desk staff or restaurant staff, all great. My only word of warning is not to let your kids get to the TV remote first The on- demand is much easier for them to access than the regular programming. I'll end up with a smallish tv bill for on-demand Disney, but I'll put that down to exhaustion and not worry about it.none

Stayed at the Hotel Monaco on 11/27 and wanted to share my experience. First off, I stayed at the Monaco in Salt Lake CIty some time ago and really enjoyed it as I was traveling with my dog and it was quite accomodating. For the Seattle location I was celebrating an anniversaru with my girlfriend of one year. We went with an upgraded room with a soaking tub which was awesome. Room was immaculate and comfortable. Plus, the staff left a bottle of chilled champagne on ice for us in honor of our celebration. Only stayed one night but would have loved to stay more. Definitely check out wine hour in the lobby 5-6 as its a lot of fun.none

We usually prefer a more modern aesthetic, but the somewhat 'quirky' decor was fun and a welcome change. Booked an excellent rate on their site and then was upgraded on our arrival and given multiple perks. (Well worth joining the Kimpton loyalty program.) Thoughtful in room touches such as use of yoga kit. Complimentary lovely local wines poured at the wine hour. Helpful staff. (Looking forward to my upcoming stay this weekend at their sister hotel, the Alexis.)none

My husband and I stayed at this property for a wedding for a friend. The hotel is wonderful! And is a GREAT location-very close to many attractions downtown Seattle. All were in walking distance. The staff was VERY friendly, and always spoke to us when we were coming and going. The free Starbucks coffee and nightly wine receptions were wonderful. When we asked about transportation back to the airport, they secured a town care for us that was less expensive than a taxi. The only negative I would have to say is that the housekeeping staff woke us up early everyday! The walls are really thin in the rooms. i could hear what my neighbors were saying. The beds were uncomfortable, and the rooms were slightly dated. The DM emailed me after my survey, and ssaid they are going to renovate soon. I would definitely stay here again in future trips to the area. I'm going to Chicago soon, and will definitely look at the Kimpton properties in the area! Overall it was a really nice place!none

This was my first experience with Hotel Monaco and I was more than pleased. It was a little piece of heaven each and every day of my stay in Seattle. Loved, loved, loved my chitah bathrobe. The staff could not have more pleasant and helpful. My bed was like sleeping on a cloud...I will definitely be backnone
Great place to stay except for the coffee in the restaurant... That is my only complaint...fantastic servicenone

Great Service, great food. Close walking distance to touristy sites and the hotel staff was more that accomidating helping my friend and I find reservations, taxis, and directions. I can't say enough good things about the entire hotel staff. It was the most relaxing part of our stay and we tried three different hotels.none
Gold fish in your room, dogs in the elevator, and an umbrella in your closet (it is Seattle after all). Need I say more. A breath of fresh air in the hotel industry.none

I added the $1 breakfast deal. In truth, the breakfast voucher is only worth $11 credit in the restaurant. I had egg whites, tomato, toast, juice, and coffee. The cost was $24! With my breakfast voucher I still owed $14... This was NOT a good deal. (the hotel did remove the full charge for the breakfast after complaining, but I did not use my other two vouchers for my other two nights stay after my first costly experiance). The hotel is great, the restaurant is not.none

I hated staying here and would never return. I was here for a 8 days but we had hot water for morning showers for only 4 of them. It's a ratty sort of decor that you get tired of looking at very quickly. The location is good but there are other hotels nearby and the worst part is that as you travel from the Monaco to the convention center and other places you stare wistfully at those other hotels wishing you had made the better choice and stayed at them. The only reasonable feature of the Monaco is the staff, all of whom are relentlessly friendly and helpful; for example, they gave us a voucher to soothe the grouchiness caused by cold morning showers. The goldfish deal is a total gimmick and matters not a bit. We didn't take advantage of the afternoon wine. Our room had a view of a concrete wall from street to sky - in other words, we could see nothing. The bed was uncomfortable and there were strange noises in the room, the source of which I could never figure out. Lots of nice hotels in Seattle but this is not one of them.none

Came to Seattle for a football game. Hotel was perfect location close enough to walk yet also close enough to the city center. Loved the hotel we had a pet goldfish on our room throughout the stay, the staff was very accommodating . The only downfall was the bar ran out of our type of beer one night but that was completely stocked the next day!none

We were visiting our daughter in Seattle. We stayed for four days. What a totally wonderful experience at the Hotel Monaco Seattle. Everyone was more than friendly and accommodating. The wine hour was very nice, and we enjoy nice wines, and theirs had the taste and appeal of fine wine. The entire hotel had the appeal of a nice, fine, hotel. It was a super experience, and one that I hope to repeat, the next time that I visit my daughter in Seattle.none

This was my first time at a Kimpton hotel, and I am now a fan. The location was perfect as I was only minutes away from Pike Public Market (must have breakfast @ Lowell's). The decor is certainly not generic. As you enter the room, you first notice the salmon pink stripe wallpaper. The blue headboard with blue vases on the wall, and even the desk chair has a blue back to match...equal fun decor. I also enjoyed the complimentary wine happy hour between 5 and 6 pm. It was a nice opportunity for me to test a WA cabernet. The complimentary coffee and tea in the morning is nice plus as well. I will be back when in Seattle. Nice place, nice location, nice people.none

For location, this hotel is ideal - it is right in the heart of downtown, we walked to Pioneer Sq, Pike Street market, downtown shopping etc. The 5pm wine reception is a really nice touch. Check-in was a bit odd - they seemed not to find our booking and were a bit uncommunicative, then our room was 904, next to the elevators, which we heard constantly. Not a big deal, other then early in the morning but one to avoid. Overall, good for a short stay.none

We thought we'd try a different hotel, and the pictures looked intriguing. Upon check in we were pleasantly surprised to find they had upgraded us to a king size room. Check in was quick and easy. Staff were friendly and helpful. We liked the free wine bar they put on between five and six pm, and the happy hour price (between 4 and 8pm) for wine and appetizers were a good deal. The location is ideal, within easy walking distance to Pike Place Market, downtown shopping and Pioneer Square. The decor in the room was different from the standard hotel, a nice change. We thought the chocolates on the bed every evening was a nice touch. A few complaints: The animal print robes felt kind of grubby, and the doors slammed when people left their rooms. Also, we had no choice but to use the valet parking. But other than that we had an enjoyable experience and would stay there again.none

We used the Hotel Monaco as home base for our recent wedding in Seattle. We chose the Monaco because it is very personal: they go our of their way to make you feel welcome, from the guys who greet you at the front door, to the complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening, to the goldfish they will give you for your room if you ask. We wanted our guests to have the same welcoming feeling, since many of them were traveling in from out of town and hadn't visited Seattle previously. During our visit the staff was very friendly and accommodating, understanding some of our weird requests (for example, we asked that our guests' goldfish be named "Cupid") and helping us out when we were in a pinch (a tux was left in a taxi trunk and the hotel recovered it for us.) The cost we worked out for the group rate was a little higher than nearby chain hotels, but we feel it was very much worth it. The Monaco will be our go-to hotel for all our visits to Seattle in the future, and we suspect it will be for our guests as well.none

We stayed here over Christmas time 2010 and had a very enjoyable stay. The boutique hotel is really nice, friendly staff and great location. They have a wine hour which is great, aside from the fact that the only wine they have is Barefoot. That surpises me for a 4 star hotel. I enjoy good wine, and can also drink not-so-good wine, just not Barefoot. It's horrible. I couldn't drink it, so had champagne instead which was great. And since our group was the only one drinking it, by the end of the hour we were given the bottle to finish. That was a nice touch. Hotel is clean and charming with it's boutique decor. Was a great stay, no doubt. I would just say, for the quality of the hotel, bump up the quality of the wine.none

From the Monaco you can walk everywhere easily in downtown Seattle. It is also very near the LINK train to go to and from the airport (for those with minimal luggage). The front office staff is very helpful and eager to please. One downside... the computers in the business center downstairs are not "free" for those of you who did not bring a laptop. A bit disappointing considering this is very nearly a "given" at most hotels these days.none

The Monaco is always one of our favorites. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are very comfortable. It's central location is fantastic. You can rest assured you will have a wonderful stay in this Kimpton hotel.none

First time in Seattle and first time in a Kimpton Hotel. Great experience for both. Hotel was VERY conveniently located and we were able to walk to everything - Pike's Market, shopping & great restaurants. We already had made dinner reservations elsewhere, but did do apps and drinks at Sazerac's in the hotel. Great atmosphere and food. Would definitely eat there on our next trip. Nice completmentary wine hour where we met some other guests and got some suggestions for places to see. Staff was very accommodating. Overnight parking fee was pretty spendy, but it appeared to get the going rate.none

I stayed two nights at the Hotel Monaco in Seattle. My room was spacious, very nicely appointed, everything was working perfectly, and it was incredibly comfortable for working in-room or just sitting and reading. The hotel itself is lovely and they have coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoons, so there's always a feeling that you're welcome and they're happy to see you. Had room service both days, and they accepted small modifications I requested to the standard menu without batting an eye. Desk service and concierge service was great and very helpful. This is a great hotel for the business traveler - makes it easy to work and to relax. I'll definitely stay here again.none

The rooms were quite spacious and comfortable and the lobby was old fashioned and lovely. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. On the down side the lighting over the sink in the bathroom was very dim as was the lighting in the room in general. I overheard guests making jokes about the very dark elevators and the hotel trying to save a little money. Housekeeping was sloppy. Had to call twice for supplies. The location is really perfect. Can walk to the Library or Pikes Market easily. Do not try to eat dinner in their restaurant before 8:00 P.M. It's a real "happy hour" hangout and extremely noisy. The other Kimpton Hotel a block away has a very nice Italian restaurant with extremely good food. Would recommend that highly.none

We just returned from a weekend stay at the Hotel Monaco. Over the years on our bi-annual trips to Seattle, we've stayed at a variety of hotels and this hotel is our favorite by far. Strongest points: a fun and pleasing decor with lots of verve and flair in the lobby and guest rooms, a pleasant and helpful staff and cosy, non-generic rooms that make you feel at home immediately. Also the room rate was very reasonable. The size of the hotel is perfect if you're seeking a more intimate feel than the quality chain hotels in Seattle provide. Both the hotel and its attached restaurant Sazerac have real character and zazzâ€¦..more so than many of the high-end traditional style hotels in Seattle. We loved the nightly wine hour in the lobby and at Sazerac enjoyed a good breakfast and a couple of terrific happy hours (This bar is rated as offering one of the top 20 happy hours in Seattle and if you've never been to Seattle ---happy hours are big-time here for both drink and food.) We requested a higher floor room and were really appreciative when the hotel staff actually did follow through and give us a lovely, quiet room on the 9th floor. The hotel is well-situated. We came in on 'The Link' from the airport and the hotel is only 2 blocks away from the University stop. (note: If you're planning to take the Link into the city from SEATAC airport be prepared for an extremely long walk with your luggage from the Airport terminals to the train. And there's no transport at the airport to the Link.) The hotel is centrally located for restaurants, shops, movie theaters, and an easy walk to many sites including the Seattle Art Museum and Pike's Market. We're definitely planning to make this our destination hotel for future trips to Seattle.none

I like staying at Kimpton Hotels, for their coffee/wine service, robes, and free wifi. The location of the Monaco in downtown Seattle is great. I walked to Pike Place Public Market in 10 minutes with the sublime Sweet Iron waffle shop one block away. Also nearby is the swanky Purple CafÃ© and Wine Bar. The light rail is a short few blocks as well. First impressions were a mixed bag. We arrived around 2:00 p.m. and our room was not ready, so the women checking us in told us the bell boy would take our bags, but that didn't happen promptly. We must have stood around for 20 minutes and had to find the bell boy ourselves. Once our room was ready we got keys and access to the express elevator, which only services floors 10-11. The keys did not work on the first try so I had to get another set. Room 1017 was smaller than we expected and the bed a lot firmer, but still comfortable with nice views of downtown. There was an off musty smell in the room, as in the robes, which have seen better days. The bathroom amenities could be nicer. The wine hour was packed with nowhere to sit. Overall, an acceptable stay, but will look elsewhere for my next visit to Seattle.none
Beautiful downtown Seattle location. Perfectly situated to Pike Place Market, shopping, etc, etc. Great lobby, fantastic service and very comfy rooms. Very restful and really fun decor. Enjoy.none

I didn't know what to expect going to the Monaco, this was my first Kimpton experience. I had arranged for an airport pickup through the hotel valet but no car arrived. It was easy to take a taxi ($38) and cheaper than the hotel car service would have been. The staff was apologetic and offered a ride back to the airport which I did take advantage of for my return. Other than that, the visit was flawless. Rooms were clean and comfortable, staff was helpful and friendly, food was good. I was celebrating a birthday while there and that was acknowledged with a bottle of champagne which my friends and I enjoyed. Oh, and the goldfish was a nice touch!none

We love kimptons and we enjoyed our stay here , but we wish Our dog was with us and that there was a pool or rooftop hot tub.. Wine hour is always great. The rooms were clean and modern but the beds were not so comfy. You are a few blocks away from the fish market and some great restaurants (Go to "list" for happy hour- half off great food and beverages inc. Wine bottles). Make sure you join kimpton rewards!none

I came to Hotel Monaco on a solo trip, only for 2 nights, but had a wonderful experience! The hotel was located in a very easy-to-find location within walking distance of all the popular attractions I wanted to see. The hotel staff was very friendly & helpful and I LOVED my room. I can't wait to come back!none

This was our first visit to Seattle, so I had lots of questions when I made the reservation. The hotel staff was friendly, patient, and very informative - made it easy to decide to stay there. When we arrived, we weren't disappointed. The reception and checkout was smooth. The room was large, clean and comfortable. The robes are a great touch. Enjoyed the wine. The staff at the restaurant was outstanding - good was great, too.none

Had a comfortable stay at the charming Monaco Hotel. Staff was friendly and competent. Lobby is fancifully decorated and comfortable with lots of little sitting areas. The free wine during the cocktail hour was graciously served and good. The sheets are nice, beds soft and the on-site restaurant is very good and just plain fun to look at. Then wait till you see the robes and slippers in the rooms. I won't spoil the surprise. Annnone

The many, many extra touches and great staff made our stay in Seattle really memorable. We loved the goldfish and leopard bathrobes! The decor was charming and the room extremely comfortable and clean. We left our baggage with the bellman before check-in and after check-out and were pleased that the staff knew this both times without being asked. Very personal. it was my husband's 50th birthday while we were there and he received champagne and chocolates. The location is perfect for walking around downtown. The food in the restaurant was delicious, and again service was excellent. I completed the survey after our stay and they actually responded! They care . . . and it shows in every detail.none

I loved every momet of my stay. I felt like I was importent. I mattered. From the door man to the frount desk, The man who got our car was sweet and helpful. The rooms were clean and smelled fresh. I cuddle in a chair with a blanket and read a book. I was at home Thanks so much.none

The bed had Frette linens and was comfortable. The sheets had some stains and a hole. The room was large and the bath nice, but there was a constant noise all night long and I couldn't figure out what it was. We were on the top floor so I settled on it being noise from the roof. Other than that, it was a pleasant stay. No view on the back side but I was warned. I wanted a higher level and that was all that was left.none

Was there for 5 days on vacation with a 2 year old and the staff was just Fantastic. Room was great, valet was super helpful and always made sure we knew where we were going. Bar and restaurant let us take drinks and utensils back to our room when we had to accommodate baby's schedule. The front desk gave our daughter a stuffed animal on check-in and put a goldfish in our room, which just made the stay for our 2 year old. Concierge managed to find someone to dry-clean my jacket for a wedding on a friday afternoon when I needed it by sat. afternoon and then handled everything for me. And the absolute highlight for us was seeing our toddler after her bath in her kid sized animal print robe! too cute. Traveling with toddlers can be a challenge and you often spend more time in the hotel than maybe your thought you would. We were always very comfortable at the Monaco and would absolutely stay there again. They are the new bar for us when vacationing at a hotel.none

We absolutely LOVED our stay here. Very convenient location, lovely room, and excellent friendly staff. The onsite restaurant Sazerac is to die for, and has a marvelous happy hour! The hotel hosts a "wine hour" at the end of the day, and this was a great way to relax and meet other guests. They will give you a goldfish in a bowl for your room, during your stay, if you request it. I thought that was a really fun twist. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would LOVE to stay there again!none

Wife and I stayed at Hotel Monaco Seattle middle of September 2011. We have stayed at Kimpton properties and Hotel Monaco (in San Francisco) before. We love the Kimpton group and Hotel Monaco Seattle was outstanding. Service cannot be beat, rooms are very nice, bar and restaurant are good, and downtown location was excellent. I heartily endorse this hotel.none
Stayed at a four season hotel then moved to this hotel. Very clean rooms and friendly serive. I highly recommend it.none

My wife and I went via train to Seattle for shopping and a Seahawks game (preseason win over the Raiders), and we stayed with Hotel Monaco primarily for the location, previous reviews, and reasonable price. We found the staff to be friendly and courteous, and our spacious room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. This hotel has all mod cons with a nice restaurant attached. Most importantly, to me, was that we could walk everywhere we wanted to be - SAM, Pike Market, Pine Street and Safeco Field. My wife forgot her cell phone charger at home and the front desk staff offered to charge it for her - so thoughtful. Seattle is a beautiful city, and having a really nice place to stay helped us to relax and enjoy it all the more.none

We had a wacky, wonderful night at the Monaco in Seattle. Great service, great bed, yummy breakfast and the best bathrobes ever. We also enjoyed the unusual decor and proximity to the Seattle sites. Would recommend it any time to couples, families or even on your own. Thank you for a great night.none

My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel from Aug. 27 through Aug. 31, 2011. We asked for a room that did not accomodate pets, and were given a spacious accomodation on the 11th floor. We were able to take the express elevator. The restaurant was great-we had booked a room with a continental breakfast (croissant, juice and coffee) but were able to get cereal, french toast, eggs etc. for an additional fee. The exercise room and Internet were free of charge. I asked for cups of hot water in the evening and they brought it up to our room within 15 minutes. The front desk staff was very helpful. Four newspapers were available in the lobby for free: The Wall Street Journal, USA Today, The New York Times, and a Seattle newspaper. The location was great. It was close to the waterfront, Pike's Market and shopping. We were able to walk to a nearby hotel to get the bus to Mt. Ranier.none

We've stayed at this hotel every year for 14 years and always enjoy it. Beautiful property. Great decor. Always super clean. Friendly staff. Centrally located in downtown Seattle. And you can get a goldfish to sleep with you!none

This is a wondeful hotel - great location - very clean and so friendly. Shane at the front desk really cares and that is rare - so many front desk people just go through the motions..... Last name....credit card... Not here - this is refreshing amazing care!none

We have stayed in Kimpton Hotels before and the personal, friendly service is consistent regardless of location. The Seattle Monaco was no different. Seattle hotels can be quite expensive in the summer, but the Monaco, while not cheap, was affordable and very well located. We had the entire family with us, so we needed a suite and two rooms. We were all located together, a great convenience. We only used room service once for coffee. The cost of room service everywhere is absurdly high these days. I cannot say it was great value, but it was delivered promptly. Service in the bar downstairs was very hospitable and the evening refreshments were welcome. Finally, the bell staff were great at getting our rather large group in as few taxis as possible and this on a weekend where taxis were at a premium.none

We went to Seattle for a weekend of dining and shopping, and stayed at the Hotel Monaco. We were able to walk to all our restaurants, plus the Pike Place Market, and even Uwajimaya, one of our regular stops. The hotel gave us a goldfish named Andrea for the weekend. After two nights I thought Andrea looked hungry, so they gave me a little packet of fish food. The New York Times was delivered to the room every morning except Sunday. The room was clean and quiet. Just as advertised there was a reception in the lobby every afternoon. I can't think of a single thing that went wrong here.none
I spent two sleepless nights in this hotel due to the pillows all being hard. I was not happy.none

The rooms are clean, the location is perfect (close to pike place and shops, but still easy to drive to Alki Beach, etc), and the service was impeccable. A really nice value added option was the 50 cents for either drinks or breakfast (we picked breakfast) that you can opt into at check in. They served us hot croissants, juices, teas, fresh fruit, etc. Also, we traveled with our little dog and they were so nice - they left her dog treats and a water bowl in the room and offered to doggy-sit her (first hour free, nominal fee thereafter). I would go back in a heartbeat!!!!none

We couldn't say enough about our stay at this hotel. Our kids loved it! The goldfish in the room was a big hit, as were the free milk and cookies, free toy chest, and free movie! They got a kick out of the animal print bathrobes. While not being a "kid hotel", they make kids feel very special. From an adult perspective, the lobby is beautiful, the rooms are nicely done and clean, the staff is great, the complimentary wine hour is a nice touch, the attached restaurant was great, and the location is awesome. Bravo--Kimpton has figured it out!none

We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 5 nights in August. The location is good. It is walking distance to Pike Place market and the monorail and there are a few good restaurants nearby. It does get a little quiet on the weekends however as it is in the financial district and we found that most places did close early making it a little diffucult to get a snack or coffee outside the hotel in the late evening. The room was very spacious making it great for us: a couple and two young children. That said, the sofa bed would have been extremely uncomfortable for an adult, but the kids did not complain at all. And it was nice to have a heavy curtain separating the space, so we could have a light on while the kids were sleeping. The welcome package for the kids was nice as was the box of toys in the lobby. We did not get a goldfish for the first few days (due to some heat wave... not sure if that was just a cute excuse for the kids or the truth) but did finally get one after a few days of nagging. Not a big deal, but I would rather they didn't advertise it unless it can be guaranteed upon arrival. The restaurant was great: we ate there twice and had two great meals.none

The staff at the Hotel Monaco from the front desk, to the waiters in the fabulous restaurant each morning to the housecleaning were incredibly kind and helpful. The hotel is located in a great location close enough to walk along the water and close enough to walk to the convention center. It is also safe at night, which I appreciated. I love all animals and adore the "idea" of having gold fish for guests, but for a slightly extra investment for a larger bowl, two fish could hang together. It is difficult enough for fish without pumped in air supply, but to be completely alone (especially gold fish which can easily live together) at least doesn't make it look so lonely. Two different people I brought to my room commented on how lonely the fish in the hall looked. Otherwise it's a fabulous place!none

We spent three great nights at the Monaco. Location is very good, on 4th Avenue, which puts it a few blocks from Elliott Bay (but then just about everything is a few blocks off the bay, since the freeway viaduct runs along the bay. The best part was the staff. They were excellent in all respects - well trained, knowledgeable and helpful. Room 501 was large and comfortable, although it had a "view" of the building across the alley. Air conditioning was a bit weak, but that was fixed by having a fan sent up. (We found the return air filter needed to be changed.) Evening wine and hors d'oeuvres were good. Restaurant was very good. We'll be back.none

My husband, our 20 month old daughter and I stayed here for three nights and had a wonderful time! All of the staff was wonderful and accomodated all of our requests immediately! Our daughter loved the fish 'Lucia' that we had in our room. It was a fun touch! We also ate at the restaurant in the lobby twice and the food was excellent! The room service was a little over priced, but we only ordered dessert. The location was great as we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go in Seattle. The valet parking was a little pricey, but they were very accomodating and even ran to our car to grab our sunglasses for us. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone! Great military/government rates for those that qualify!none

If you want a nice room in Seattle in the summer you'll pay for it but this place is worth it. Very knowledgable and accomodating staff. Extremely comfortable bed with very nice linens. I'd come back!none

I have stayed here multiple times on business and pleasure. Everytime is amazing. The staff is always friendly and accommodating and the rooms are great. Free WiFi in the room for intouch members (sign up for free). The staff and environment always makes me feel like I'm in luxury, but without any snootyness or snobery. Plus...every night at 5pm they have wine hour which makes for a perfect starter to the evening events :) I have also stayed here with my 3yr old son and this place is great for kids. They greet him with a little plush toy upon entering and always have his kids leopard print robe ready next to mine. To top it all off, they give him a pet goldfish in the room that he always gets a kick out of.none

I stayed here with my boyfriend for two nights on a very busy weekend in Seattle. I was happy to snag a room here for a better price than a lot of other hotels in the area. Kimpton never disappoints. Definitely join their 'in touch' program. I got upgraded a room level and a mini bar credit. The front desk staff was super friendly. The decor is a bit overdone, but the room was a good size, clean and the bed was comfy. The wireless was not good, I just used my 3G all weekend. The restaurant serves a surprisingly good breakfast. Valet parking is expensive, but I think that's standard downtown.none

We stayed here when we spent the night in Seattle on our way to Alaska via Holland America cruiselines. Its in a great location downtown and offered us a great experience into Seattle on our first ever visit there. Highly recommended.none

From the moment our car pulled up to the sidewalk, to the check in which took less than one minute, service at this hotel was something sweet. Room was comfortable and nice, great amenities, excellent room service breakfast without having to go to an ATM machine or getting a mortgage on the house, this place is a great value. Close to downtown shopping and restaurants. We would definitely stay here again!none
This was by far the greatest hotel we had stayed at! We regret only staying there one night, we wish we could have stayed longer!!none

We have stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Salt Lake City a couple times. So when I found out we had to get a hotel in Seattle for a night I was pleased to see there was a Hotel Monaco downtown. We were not disappointed. We were greeted by friendly staff and the room was clean and spacious. The hotel is located within walking distance of many downtown Seattle sights. We are looking forward to trying out Kimpton properties in other cities.none

Love this hotel for business or personal travel. They had to replace the phone in my room and delivered a box of chocolates to apologize. Also love that Kimpton in touch program gives you a $10 minibar credit and free wifi.none

We booked this hotel through Hotwire at a rate of $120 per night. Check-in was smooth, bathroom and linens were clean, hallways were quiet and the staff was helpful and friendly. The only thing I didn't like was having a goldfish in the room because they're in such small bowls. Didn't use any services as we only stayed the one night. Am staying there again next month!none
We loved this hotel. Very clean and well-appointed. The rates are super reasonable. Overall, this chain of hotels (Kimpton) really delivers. Check it out!none

I agree with all ot the previous, positive comments on here. So here are some additional tips. Sign up to be a Kimpton In-Touch Member and you'll get $10 to "raid the mini bar" upon your arrival, plus free internet. Also, The Monaco has a very small gym in the hotel and your room card will get you access to Gold's Gym (2.5 blocks away). It's a smaller sized gym and the equipment is great!none

We recently stayed 6 nights with 3 adult children (2 rooms) for vacation. I can not think of anything I did not like about this place. Conveniently located to practically everything, we were able to walk everywhere, including the Amtrak station to catch our train. All the employees were friendly and helpful, especially the turn down service woman. Routinely coming to the room after our east coast time zone bodies were past ready for bed, she eagerly gave us plenty of chocolates and left us alone! Get a goldfish delivered to your room, even if you think it's silly. You'll be amazed how attached you can get to a goldfish! The rooms are spacious (we had a king suite and a queen) with plenty of places to sit besides just the bed. The beds are comfortable, clean, and the water pressure in the shower is amazing! I love the full size shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel pump bottles in the shower. Not having to fumble with tiny bottles and caps is nice. We never seemed to be around for the wine reception (so much to do!), but did have breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant and it was very good. The value of the rooms, especially with the AAA rate, was excellent. I've stayed in many hotels not nearly as nice for more money. I will not hesitate to stay here again if I am in Seattle.none

I have nothing but good things to say about the Monaco. We spent 2 night there before we went on an Alaskan cruise. The hotel is a short walk from the Pike St. Market and just a few blocks in the orher direction from the Ferry Terminal. The rooms are clean and spacious and the service is excellent. They have a complimentary wine tasting in the lobby every evening and you can even get a goldfish delivered to your room to keep you company if you like. The Sazarac Restauraunt is located on the first floor. The food and service is decent and they have a nice happy hour with inexpensive appitizers. I would say if you are flying into Seattle don't bother with a rental car. Valet parking at the Monaco is $35 per night. Take a shuttle in from the airport. The city has a good public transportation system, the busses downtown are free, and cabs are easy to find.none

Hotel staff were wonderful! Hotel was clean--the room & most importantly, the bathroom, were very clean! The free wine reception hour was wonderful! The hotel is close to Pike Place Market, famous Post Alley, and wonderful shopping (Nordstrom, Tiffany & Co., Macy's, etc., etc.) and is in a very safe part of town--walking around, even later at night, wasn't an issue.none

We stayed here for two nights while in town for a Seattle Sounders game. We were traveling with our two boys, ages 7 and 4. They LOVED our "pet" goldfish, Pink. The evening wine/soft drinks/appetizer reception was a nice touch. We booked the AAA "50% off Parking Package" which made this a decent value. I signed up for the Kimpton program as advised by other Tripadvisor members and received free in-room WiFi and a $10 mini bar voucher. The kids are already asking when we can schedule a return visit to see "Pink"!none

Working with Hotel Monaco was fantastic, Ariela was amazingly helpful with changes and altering the block of rooms and the dates of everyone coming into town. While at the hotel, the staff was super helpful and incredibly friendly. The rooms were comfortable and beautiful. We would recommend them highly for working to make your event wonderful!none

With my two kids in tow, I walked up to the front desk to try and see if I could check in early. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to but the front desk clerk was so courteous and helpful I am glad I wasn't. He pointed out many areas of interest within walking distance of the hotel, and then called me personally when our room was ready. He also gave my little guy a free movie credit for the night. Room service food was exceptional as well, and seriously, I wish I could have stayed my entire trip there. I would highly recommend it.none

I love Kimpton Hotels, but I do think that their room rates were too pricey for what they offered ($250.00). The rooms were very small -- almost like a large walk-in closet. The gym downstairs was cramped, as well, with just a couple of cardio machines. They do have an agreement with Gold's Gym where guests can use Gold's during their stay with Hotel Monaco, but be prepared to hike a few blocks down the street. They offer free wi-fi, which is good. They also had a cocktail hour in the lobby at 5 pm at which they serve beer, wine, sangria and other non-alcoholic bevs, in addition to some finger food.none

We recently stayed in this hotel for a week and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The rooms are great. They take you beyond the norm as far as decor goes. Really refreshing. The nightly wine reception was very nice. They had a nice selection of non alcoholic drinks for those that didn't wish to have the wine. The hotel itself is right in the heart of downtown. Easy walking distance to the Pike Public Market, shopping, 5th avenue theater etc. The staff go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and appreciated. When looking for a restaurant to go to one evening we asked at the front desk about a certain place. We were told straight out that the place was not worth the time or our money. They tell it to you straight up. If arriving by air at the SeaTac airport, you can hop on the Light Link Rail and arrive at a station just one block from the hotel. $6.00 instead of $50 for a cab. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone.none

This was a lovely hotel and the front desk staff were very welcoming and informative. They had a nice selection of little toys for the children to choose from when we got there and the kids also loved their pet fish.none

We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 4 nights while exploring downtown Seattle and the tourist attractions before taking a cruise. We love the fun, quirky extras that Kimptons provide...My daughters really got a kick out of our goldfish, Dave. :-) The staff were all very helpful and friendly, and the atmosphere was lovely. The location, in the financial district, may not have been ideal for a family vacation, but everything we wanted to do was within walking distance or easily accessible by public transportation. The in-hotel restaurant caters more to an adult, hip crowd, rather than being family-friendly, but there are plenty of choices in downtown Seattle, and not enough time to enjoy them all!
